data.title: Install the extension marketplace story needs update
data.body:
1. Most of the extensions currently have a description on how to install that extension (by opening quick open and pasting some commands) - example: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mousetraps.quicksnippet#review-details
2. Due to the introduction of the extension viewlet all those install descriptions become depracted

So we should somehow notify the extension writers that this description needs to change.

Also it would be cool if the user could just click on a link in that description and vscode would automatically start downloading that extension.

data.title: Feedback that a restart is required is missing
data.body:
1. Extensions viewlet -> install material theme
2. Once installed -> choose switch theme and get puzzled why the material theme is missing
3. The issue is that the user did not get notified in any way that a restart is required to the extension gets fully functional

So we need some state in the viewlet that would show the user the extension will get enabled only after a restart.

data.title: Clicking on a markdown preview does not set focus on editor
data.body:
1. Open markdown preview of a file
2. Click somewhere else so your editor loses focus
3. Click somewhere in the markdown preview - notice how the editor does not gain focus. If you click on its tab header the editor nicely gains focus
4. Clicking on the editor should always give it focus

This is now more visible since we show extensions description using a markdown preview.
fyi @joaomoreno

data.title: Scrollbar out of style for extension descriptions
data.body:
1. Open an extension description
2. Notice the native scrollbar which looks out of style since we do not use it anywhere else in VSCode
3. I would expect our regular scroll bar which we use everywhere else (also for markdown preview)

![screen shot 2016-06-22 at 09 50 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16258599/db95e750-385e-11e6-8971-08852af7e468.png)

data.title: Extensions: where is progress?
data.body: When clicking 'update' in the extensions viewlet you don't see progress as the extension is updated and you do not get prompted to restart.

data.title: Extensions Viewlet: Don't see extension's icon on Windows
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/16258584/cd968196-385e-11e6-8082-4ee8c89b59ea.png)

data.title: Screen reader support missing in extensions viewlet

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
1. Turn on VoiceOver
2. Go to extensions viewlet -> whatever you do screen reader is silent
3. I would expect I hear out the text in the input box, and the currently selected extension is read out

data.title: Not possible to install / uninstall extension via keyboard
data.body:
I like how the keydown starts going through the list and how enter opens the extension description.
I would exprect that an enter on already selected list item installs / uninstalls that extension.

The alternative is that you open extension description on each up / down and on enter install / uninstall. I think this might also work nicely

data.title: Uninstall button color blends too much in extensions header background
data.body:
The uninstall button needs a clearer distinction from the extensions header background. Currently it blends too much and the user can easily ignore this button.
I like how it looks in the list, and I think it should have consistent color with the one in the header but I believe we can find a color which will work for both places.

Maybe increasing the size as suggested in #7964 might fix this issue

![screen shot 2016-06-22 at 09 41 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16258313/973a20b8-385d-11e6-941b-a7150dbd90fb.png)

data.title: Install button in extension header too small
data.body:
The install button in the extensions header is the same size as the install button in the list - that is nice for consistency but:
1. there is too much empty space in the header
2. this is the most important action a user can take

Due to these reasons I believe the install button should be larger in the extensions header
Same for the uninstall button for the installed extensions header

![screen shot 2016-06-22 at 09 38 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16258226/185a7ae0-385d-11e6-9042-031d66d822dd.png)

data.title: Problems with git commands and vscode

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: ANY
- OS Version: Windows 10 (should be any)

When I try to run commands such as `git checkout`, `git rebase`, or even `git stash pop` from the command line (powershell), many times it fails to complete the command, failing with this error, or an equivalent:

```
fatal: cannot create directory at 'src/app/...': Permission denied
```

The command also fails and thus leaving me to do a lot of manual cleaning up to restore to previous version.

It seems to me that vscode locks up the files and doesn't let Windows access them creating this problem.

Probable Steps to Reproduce: (I can't reproduce it completely reliably, but it's a start)
1. In a git repo, create a new folder and move an existing (tracked) file into that folder
2. Now stash your changes with a `git stash -u`
3. Now, apply your stash.
4. Fail

---
1. Make some changes to your code.
2. Pull from upstream.
3. Try a rebase
4. Fail (70% of the time)

data.title: Clear button not visible enough
data.body:
The current extensions input clear has some flaws:
1. Too far away from input
2. Looks disabled
3. Too small
4. Mouse does not transform to click while hovering over it
5. No hover information
6. Looks out of style compared to our other input buttons (find, search)

Due to this reasons this button can easily get ignored 

![screen shot 2016-06-22 at 09 35 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16258129/a544f18e-385c-11e6-84d9-be968c3636dc.png)

data.title: Treating extensions description editor as regular editors?
data.body:
Currently the extensions description window is just like any other editor - which means I can quick open away from it, I can split editor it eg...

Do we want to allow all these actions or we need to treat it in some special way?
My argument is that the user never wants to see more than 1 and the user does not want to see this once he is not in the extensions viewlet.

If we treat them as regular editors - I would expect they do not pollute my quick open history and that I just see 1 instance of them

![screen shot 2016-06-22 at 09 32 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16258053/3ee44066-385c-11e6-991e-428df137bb81.png)

data.title: With tabs enabled, cannot view the active tab's file path without using mouse

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It seems this is very cumbersome to do:
- Copy path to active file command and paste somewhere
- Open in file viewer and look at the OS explorer

data.title: Extensions icon might need polish
data.body:
If we are ever going to change the extensions icon now is the time.
I am not the biggest fan of the current icon so creating this issue just to raise my concern.

When I look at the current icon 'extensions' is not the first term that comes to my mind.
This is just my opinon so feel free to close

![screen shot 2016-06-22 at 09 23 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16257831/1b5435a8-385b-11e6-9889-bfe48b5d4dbb.png)

data.title: No keyboard shortcut to open extensions viewlet
data.body:
1. There is not shortcut to open the extensions viewlet (like all other viewlets have it)

I propose shit + cmd + x

data.title: With hungarian layout '\' cannot be entered to the the nested terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Professional versin 1511 build 10586.420

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VSCode
2. Press the Ctrl+ keys, which toogle the terminal (why not Ctrl+0, the key placed to the same position as Ctrl+` on the US layout?
3. Press AltGr+q to input '\' on hungarian layout

Expected result:
Terminal opens with cmd.exe, and \ appears in the terminal.

Actual result:
Terminal opens with cmd.exe and q appears in the terminal.

data.title: Extensions viewlet: add some in-progress hint for update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: Mac OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have an extension out of date
2. Navigate to Extension Viewlet, it shows a update button, click it. 

Expected: The update button switches to a install-in-progress image similar to what we have in command palette.
Actual: Nothing happens. We don't know whether it's updating or not.

data.title: A reload or restart option could be great.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1
- OS Version:arch linux

when i updated some definition files or some path it does not show in vscode instantly so i have to close vscode and reopen .
If there is a reload option like just after installing extensions it would be great

data.title: Visual Studio Code type definition for string lacks methods such as startsWith
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1
- OS Version:1511 10586.318

Steps to Reproduce:
1. let s:string = "ok";
2. s.startsWith('$', 0);

There should be no error information below for method startsWith
error TS2339: Property 'startsWith' does not exist on type 'string'.

Hit F12 in VSCode on existing method "charAt" of string type and go to the lib.d.ts and the method startsWith doesn't exist in interface string.

Open the same typescript code in Visual Studio 2015 and the method startsWith already exists.

data.title: Images do not show updated when changed on disk
data.body:
**New description @bpasero**
Depends on https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/6275

**Old**
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1-1.3.0 latest
- OS Version: windows(test) most likely all

1- Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder with 5 or so large images in vscode
2. click between them quickly
3. vscode crashes

2- Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project in vscode
2. Enable tabs
3. Open some large files quickly and switch between them

data.title: Linux: watcher can produce ENOSPC when too many handles open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2
- OS Version: CentOS 7 running on VMPlayer 12

The error which I am getting is 

```
[srinath@osboxes ~]$ code --verbose
bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell
Error: watch /home/srinath/.config/Code/User ENOSPC
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:890:11)
    at FSWatcher.start (fs.js:1323:19)
    at Object.fs.watch (fs.js:1351:11)
    at r.e.registerWatchers (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:8:16692)
    at r.e (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:8:15951)
    at new r (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:8:19184)
    at v (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:15395)
    at t._createInstance (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:7:23640)
    at t._createAndCacheServiceInstance (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:7:24615)
    at t._getOrCreateServiceInstance (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:7:23801)
```

I think while exiting suddenly (Because of sudden OS shutdown) it is unable to close some files or something.

```
```

data.title: File > Close Editor with no open file, closes VS Code (crash?)
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1-stable, 1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open a file 
2. File > Close Editor   - this closes the file
3. File > Close Editor   - this exits VS Code (same as File > Close Window)

Not sure if this is crash or just a regular exit.

data.body: DND of tabs and editors is broken/works bad on Linux.

data.title: Multiple copies of the same file being opened with different paths

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Xenial

I am seeing frequent cases of multiple instances of the same file being opened with different paths.

For instance, I have in my 'Working Files' area:
  MySource.cpp  - myproj/src
  MySource.cpp  - ///home/myuser/blah/blah/myproj/src

One copy is opened relative to my project directory, the other has a strange absolute path, and they're both the same file.
This causes problems; if I edit and save one of those files, then switch to the other file, it will detect on-disk changes, then produce a diff window showing me on-disk compared to in-editor state and asking me to resolve.

This shouldn't happen. Paths should be normalised and avoid this situation.

data.title: Test: Markdown extension
data.body:
Test plan for #6106
- [x] Windows - @bpasero 
- [x] OS X - @sandy081 
- [x] Linux - @aeschli 

Verify
- syntax highlighting in markdown source in all built-in themes
- working markdown preview in all built-in themes
- "open preview" file explorer context menu contribution
- "Show preview", "Open Preview to the Side", "Show source" editor action bar contributions
- keybindings for open/toggle preview
- test custom styles (see #6688)
- test custom styles paths including '#' (see #3613)

data.title: openssh-askpass keeps poping up
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

I am not sure what is causing this, but whenever I one of my projects I keep getting this popup. It locks up everything so I couldn't do a print screen. Anyways No matter what I do, it keeps opening. If I Press `Cancel` or `Ok` it goes away then pop back up a few minutes later. If I try entering a password, or `Yes`/`No` into the input box it still comes back a few minutes later.

![openssh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1571806/16251796/b74e3778-37ee-11e6-847f-c28a08e49176.jpg)
